body:
I'm not sure. I think the "is this a reusable instance?" confusion is important, but it's not all consuming. I'm certainly willing to entertain another try.

I actually wanted to make this work because I liked how the example code looked, but then I applied the approach to a bunch of controllers I had and the after code was worse than the before code in every case. I'd be happy to give that another try if you guys come up with a break through.

On Dec 24, 2012, at 9:43 AM, Yehuda Katz <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @dhh Thanks for your feedback. I hadn't heard the preloading argument before and I find it compelling. I think it's possible to address that problem; I'll pursue it with @sferik in a plugin, and perhaps come back around if we think we cracked the nut.
> 
> Are there any other concerns you have about the approach that you haven't outlined? I want our plugin to be as robust as possible in the face of real-world controllers, and any additional issues you forsee would help us.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
> 
>
